page.title: 01The Warnham and Rowhook Area
page.content: The area forms part of the clay lowlands of southern England with hills capped with Horsham stone. It is an agricultural area, the predominant land use being dairy farming. The main settlement is Warnham, a commuter village serving Horsham, Gatwick and London;Rowhook is the only other notavle settlement and is no ;more than a hamlet. There is a high proportion of elderly and retired people in the area's population.In the south eastern corner there is a commercial red deer park with public access via footpaths. Main road access is NorthEast/SouthWest, the A29 basically following the route of the Roman Stone Street.
